newsitem.title: IRAN: Iran MP says oil well problems hampering output.
newsitem.headline: Iran MP says oil well problems hampering output.

text.p: An Iranian deputy has warned that lack of maintenace of oil wells was preventing Iran from meeting its OPEC production quota.

Mohsen Yahyavi, a member of the parliament's oil commission, told the daily Iran News that production had fallen by 80,000 barrels per day (bpd) below the country's 3.6 million bpd quota because of lack of funds.
"He (Yahyavi) said Iran's oil wells are not maintained well because of lack of financial support by the government," the English-language newspaper reported on Sunday.
"If there are no improvements, Iran will be forced to reduce its production further by an estimated 110,000 barrels a day," Yahyavi said.
Yahyavi also said an estimated price of $17.5 per barrel in the budget for the next Iranian year which starts on March 21 was unrealistic.
"Our commission proposed...estimated oil prices of $16.5 a barrel for the proposed annual budget," Yahyavi added.
